title: Amexio panel
description: Panel provides an easy way to organize big forms by grouping the fields in panel.

gridData.name: title
gridData.description: Title for panel.

gridData.name: header
gridData.description: Enable/Disabled header.

gridData.name: expanded
gridData.description: Pane will expand or collapse based on the boolean.

gridData.name: border
gridData.description: Provides the border for panel if true

gridData.name: content-align
gridData.description: Provides the alignment(left, right, center) for content present in panel

gridData.name: collapsible
gridData.description: Provides the collapse property, if true

gridData.name: height
gridData.description: Height of panel must be in px ex.100, 250..

gridData.name: context-menu
gridData.description: Context Menu provides the panel on right click(for Array structure: refer typescript code in source tab)

gridData.name: amexio-panel-header
gridData.description: Panel Header renders any component within it by using toolbar as its outer shell

gridData.name: background
gridData.description: Provides background color for panel header

gridData.name: color
gridData.description: Provides foreground color for panel header

gridData.name: enable-lifecycle-events
gridData.description: Enable lifecycle events example [all/init/ready/destroy].

gridData.name: fit
gridData.description: sets fit layout for panel.

gridData.name: onClick
gridData.description: Fires the on accordion pane click event.

gridData.name: rightClick
gridData.description: It is fired when clicked on context menu providing Panel node data and selected context menu data.

gridData.name: initiated
gridData.description: Event fired if 'all' or 'init' is set as input to enable-lifecycle-events.

gridData.name: ready
gridData.description: Event fired if 'all' or 'ready' is set as input to enable-lifecycle-events.

gridData.name: destroy
gridData.description: Event fired if 'all' or 'destroy' is set as input to enable-lifecycle-events.

gridData.name: Tab
gridData.description: Should navigate over elements of panel and read the name of panel label.

gridData.name: Space && Enter
gridData.description: Should read Expand and collapse and should read the panel label name.
